segments.text: So , how should we get to the theatre ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I hate the bus system in London ! The bus drivers are rude , the buses are never on time , and there are few people around who can help you .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It's not that bad . You probably just had a bad experience once .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It wasn't just once . Every single time I take the bus , something bad happens to me or to someone else on the bus .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: We could take the subway , but we'd have to go three stops along one line and then change trains twice .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Train fares are twice as expensive as the bus fare , too .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: If we don't hurry up , we'll miss the show . Should we take the bus ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: We're already late , so I think we had better take a taxi .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I don't think we'll be able to find a taxi very easily during hush hours . Let's just take the bus .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Fine . Have a look at the timetable to find out when the next one arrives .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It looks like it should be here in just a few minutes . don't worry . Nothing bad will happen . I'll even buy your ticket for you .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Thanks , that was nice of you .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: See , now something good has happened to you on a bus trip !
segments.speaker: S2
